distro.desc:
# Red Hat

Red Hat is a leading provider of open-source enterprise solutions, particularly known for its Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) operating system. Red Hat's commitment to stability, security, and support has made it a trusted choice for enterprise environments. RHEL serves as the foundation for various other distributions and is renowned for its focus on reliability and long-term support.

Features and Philosophy

  • Enterprise-Grade Support: Red Hat offers professional support services for its enterprise customers, ensuring timely security updates, bug fixes, and expert assistance.
  • Security and Stability: RHEL prioritizes security and stability, making it suitable for mission-critical applications in industries such as finance, healthcare, and telecommunications.
  • Ecosystem of Solutions: Beyond the operating system, Red Hat provides a comprehensive ecosystem of solutions, including container orchestration (OpenShift), middleware, and cloud management.

Basic Commands

Red Hat and its derivatives use the YUM (Yellowdog Updater Modified) package manager. Here are some essential commands:

  • yum update: Update the system and installed packages.
  • yum install [package]: Install a new package.
  • yum remove [package]: Remove a package.
  • yum list installed: List all installed packages.
  • yum search [keyword]: Search for packages matching a keyword.
